intro: Hieracium epinephum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with purple markings. Hieracium epinephum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
